description: Nadia Ahmed is a talented chef from Bangladesh with over 10 years of experience in creating mouth-watering dishes. She has developed 150 recipes that reflect her love for Bangladeshi cuisine and showcase the diverse flavors of the region. With a rating of 4.5, Nadia is known for her innovative approach to cooking and her ability to fuse traditional Bangladeshi ingredients with modern cooking techniques. Her passion for food is evident in every dish she creates, and she takes pride in sharing her knowledge and skills with others.
cooking_method: Clean the fish and cut into pieces.
In a pan, heat the mustard oil and sauté the onions, garlic, and ginger until they are soft and translucent.
Add the tomatoes and chilies and cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the turmeric, cumin, and coriander and stir well.
Add enough water to cover the fish and bring to a boil.
Season with salt and serve hot with rice.

description: Kabir Khan is a renowned Bangladeshi chef with over 15 years of experience in creating delicious and authentic Bangladeshi dishes. He has developed 200 recipes that showcase the rich flavors and traditions of Bangladeshi cuisine. With a rating of 4.7, Kabir is known for his mastery of traditional cooking techniques and his ability to create dishes that are both flavorful and visually appealing. His passion for food is evident in every dish he creates, and he loves to share his knowledge and skills with others.
cooking_method: Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain and set aside.
In a large pot, heat the ghee over medium heat and sauté the onions, garlic, and ginger until they are soft and translucent.
Add the meat and cook until it is browned on all sides.
Add the chilies, spices, and yogurt and stir well.
Add the soaked rice and enough water to cover it by about an inch.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Serve hot with raita or chutney.

cooking_method: In a large pot, heat the ghee over medium heat and sauté the onions, garlic, and ginger until they are soft and translucent.
Add the meat and cook until it is browned on all sides.
Add the chilies, spices, and yogurt and stir well.
Add the soaked rice and enough water to cover it by about an inch.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Add saffron to the rice and stir gently to distribute the color.
Serve hot with raita or chutney.
